result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin T Carl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class A felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

The court finds the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time but if provided with appropriate medication and treatment, is likely to become competent.  Court further orders involuntary administration of medication. 
The court orders the defendant committed to the Department of Health Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months.  DHS is authorized to administer medications or treatment to the defendant and shall observe appropriate medical standars in doing so. 
The institute shall periodically re-examine the defendant and furnish written reports to the court 3 months, 6 months and 9 months after commitment and 30 days prior to the expioratio of the commitment.

Defendant Justin T Carl in court, in custody, with Stand by Counsel Mark S Rosen.   Lesli S Boese and Kristi Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin with Detective Servando Benitez. Day 6 of Jury Trial. Jurors are not present. Court takes up issues with both parties regarding expected testimony. Jurors called in at 8:35 a.m. Detective Benitez is brought back to the stand. Sworn in and continues testimony. Defendant begins cross examination. Redirect by the State. Recross by the Defendant. Witness is excused. State calls Major Gary Hart to the stand. Sworn in and testifies. State offers exhibit 71. No questions from the Defendant. Witness is excused. State calls Detective Edward Bergin. Sworn in and testifies. Cross examination by the Defendant. No further questions from the State. Witness is excused. State rests. Jurors excused at 9:38 a.m. State moves for the admission of exhibits 60 and 71. No objection from the Defendant. Court will receive the exhibits. Court addresses the dismissal of this case. The court will not dismiss this case. Court conducts colloquy with the Defendant regarding his right to testify. The Defendant has chosen to not testify. Court takes a break at 9:47 a.m. Court reconvenes at 9:59 a.m. Same appearances. Jurors called in at 10:03 a.m. Defendant calls Elda E. to the stand. Sworn in and testifies. Cross examination by the State. No further questions from the Defendant. Witness is excused. Defendant calls Molly S. (formerly Molly F.) to the stand. Sworn in and testifies. Defendant offers exhibit 171. Jurors asked to step out at 10:32 a.m. Jurors called back in at 10:35 a.m. Defendant continues direct examination. Cross examination by the State. Redirect by the Defendant. Jurors asked to step out at 10:48 a.m. Jurors called back in at 10:50 a.m. Court will not allow Defendant to continue questioning this witness. Witness is excused. Court will admit exhibit 171. Defendant calls Andrew E. to the stand. Sworn in and testifies. Cross examination by the State. Redirect by the Defendant. No further questions from the State. Witness is excused. Defendant calls Leah G. to the stand. Sworn in and testifies. No questions from the State. Witness is excused. Defense rests. No rebuttal testimony by the State. Defendant Justin T Carl in court, in custody, with attorney Maura McMahon and Adam J. Schleis.   Lesli S Boese and Kristie Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin with Detective Servando Benitez.  Court addresses the competency report filed by Dr. Collins.  Parties make initial statements.  Defendant's letter filed in Court by the defense.  Court addresses the letter with the parties.  Court questions the defendant if he believes he is competent to proceed.  Defendant believes he is competent.  Court orders a hearing is necessary.  Court contacts the doctor to find out her availability.  Attorney McMahon moves for a mistrial.  Court holds that motion for a mistrial in abeyance at this time.   Court advises the doctor is available to appear by phone at 10:30 am today to hold the hearing.  Parties are not in objection to having the doctor appear by phone.  Court grants the request to have the doctor appear by phone at 10:30 am.  Court to reconvene at that time.  Court reconvenes at 10:29 am. Dr. Deborah Collins appears by phone.  All other parties appear as stated previously.  Dr. Deborah Collins sworn in, testified.  Court takes the letter by the defendant as his opposition to the finding of incompetency as stated.  Court finds the State has met its burden of proof and finds the defendant incompetent at this time as stated.  Court commits the defendant to the Department of Health Services.  Both parties believe a mistrial is needed.  Court declares a mistrial of the jury trial as stated. Court releases the jurors from this trial at this time.  Court to contact the jurors to let them know not to appear for trial tomorrow 9/21/2016.  Review on comptency hearing scheduled.

Case called at 8:15 am for day 5 of the jury trial.  Defendant Justin T Carl in court, in custody, with attorney Maura McMahon and Adam J. Schleis.   Lesli S Boese and Kristie Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin with Detective Servando Benitez.  Court addresses the defendant regarding a fair trial and his conduct.  Attorney McMahon raises the issue of defendant's competency and does not believe we can go forward with trial.  Attorney Boese does not feel the Court has any choice but to order a competency evaluation but wishes to keep this jury going after a quick evaluation.  State does not wish to empanel another jury.  Defendant personally does not agree with the competency issue being raised. Court orders a competency examination.  Court suspends the proceedings at this time.  Competency evaluation is to be done FORTHWITH.  Court questions the mechanics on how to keep this jury impaneled.  Parties continue with statements.  Attorney McMahon moves for a mistrial.  Court will take up the issue of mistrial on Tuesday.  Court will compose a statement to give to the jurors.  Parties agree with the statement composed to give the jury.  Court gives a copy to each of the jurors.  Court will contact the parties once it knows who will be doing the examination.  Court addresses exhibits.  Court to proceed on Tuesday 9/20/2016 @ 8:30 am for a hearing on competency / Mistrial motion.  Jury to report back to court for trial on Wednesday 9/21/2016 @ 8:30 am unless ordered otherwise.

Case called at 8:34 am for day 2 of the jury trial.  Defendant Justin T Carl in court, in custody, with attorney Maura McMahon and Adam J. Schleis.   Lesli S Boese and Kristie Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin with Detective Servando Benitez.  All 14 jurors have returned, entered the courtroom.  Defendant places an objection on the record.  Court excuses jury from the courtroom.  Attorney McMahon makes statements advising the defendant wishes to have new counsel.  Defendant makes statements.  Court addresses the speedy trial demand brought up by the defendant. Court addresses the ineffective counsel statements.  Court denies the request for new counsel at this time.  Court orders this case move forward.  Court orders no more disruptive behavior from the defendant.  Defendant continues to voice that he is firing his attorneys.  Court makes statements advising the defendants request to fire his attorneys, denying the defendant's motion.  Attorney McMahon makes statements with concerns, moves for a mistrial, and advises the defendant waives his speedy trial demand.  Court addresses the defendant, asking questions.  Court stands down.  Court reconvenes at 9:05 am.  Court makes statements.  Court swears in defendant, testified to questions of the Court.  Court reads certain statutes on the record.  Court swears in Attorney Maura McMahon, testified to questions of the Court.  Attorney Boese makes statements.  Court stands down so the State may speak with the victims family.  Court reconvenes at 10:06 am.  Attorney Boese makes statements regarding the victims wishes.  Court makes oral ruling as to the request for a mistrial and new counsel.  Court denies the request to adjourn the trial.  Court requires counsel to continue to represent the defendant as stated on the record.  Court admonishes the defendant not to have any further outbursts in Court.  Defendant is to put all further request in writing.  Court will move forward with the jury trial.  Court takes a short recess.  

Court reconvenes at 10:29 am.  Jury enters the courtroom.  Attorney Gordon gives opening statements.  Attorney McMahon gives opening statements.  State calls witness S. Huemann sworn in, testified.  Court excuses the jurors for lunch, to return by 12:45 pm.  After the jury leaves the courtroom, court addresses some of the exhibits being used, previously admitted on 8/25/2016 at the deposition hearing.  Court considers exhibits 1-17 & 19 admitted on 8/25/2016 to be admitted for today's purpose as well.  Court addresses Attorney McMahon's objection during the State's opening statements.  Court makes oral ruling admonishing the State as on the record.  Court reconvenes at 12:45 pm.  Court addresses a written question sent to the court by one of the jurors.  Witness S. Huemann returns to the witness stand.  Jurors return to the courtroom.  Court addresses the juror's question on the record with the parties and jurors.  Cross examination of the witness begins.  

State calls witness K. Green, sworn in, testified.  Court excuses the jury for a short recess.  Court addresses video testimony going to be shown to the jury.  Court reconvenes at 2:09 pm.  Court makes statements with the parties regarding the video testimony.  Jury returns to the courtroom.  

Video testimony of minor witness G.G. shown to the jury.  Attorney McMahon requests a short recess.  Court excuses the jury for a short break.  Court reconvenes at 3:14 pm.  Defense is not requesting to cross examine the minor child G.G.  Jury returns to the courtroom.  Court lets the jury know the defense is not cross examining the minor child G.G.  

State calls witness Officer Bradley R. Condon, sworn in, testified.

State calls witness S. Fischer, sworn in, testified. 

State calls witness Officer Joseph Tolfa, sworn in, testified.

Case called at 8:33 am for day 1 of the jury trial.  Defendant Justin T Carl in court, in custody, with attorney Maura McMahon and Adam J. Schleis.   Lesli S Boese and Kristie Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin with Detective Servando Benitez from the City of Waukesha.  Court addresses information of the potential jurors to be seated in the jury box, each side will have 8 juror strikes.  Court addresses the appearance of the defendant.  Defendant will be photographed to acknowledge the stun-belt is not able to be seen by the public.  Court advises the defendant to speak with his attorneys if he has questions, not address the court.  Attorney Mcmahon makes statements regarding a preliminary jury instruction.  Court addresses the preliminary instruction in question.  Bailiff exits the courtroom to retrieve approximately 50 of the jurors at 8:52 am.  Court continues to address the preliminary instruction without the jury.  Stipulation as to the prior felony conviction signed by all parties, filed in Court. Parties address possible witnesses.  Court addresses the length of the trial.  Court addresses 2 possible jurors with medical excuses.  Court addresses the voir dire questions requested by the parties.  Court reads the letter filed in Court by the defendant.  Court addresses and clarify things addressed in the defendant's letter, parties make statements regarding the letter. Court takes a short recess to wait for the jury.  Jury arrives at 9:55 am.  50 jurors arrive into the Court room.  Additional jurors remain in the jury room in case additional jurors are needed.  30 potential jurors seated in the jury box.  Court addresses the jury trial with the potential jurors.  Potential jurors sworn in.  Court begins voir dire.  Juror #33 is struck for cause.  Court calls juror #34 to the jury box.  Voir dire continues.  Jurors #25 and 32 are struck for cause.  Court calls jurors #35 and 36 to the jury box.  Voir dire continues.  Juror #28 is struck for cause.  Court calls juror #37 to the jury box.  Voir dire continues.  Juror request short break.  Court takes a short recess.  Court resumes at 10:59 am.  All jurors returned.  Court continues with voir dire.  Juror #7 struck for cause.  Court calls juror #38 to the jury box.  Voir dire continues.  Juror #38 struck for cause.  Court calls Juror #39 to the jury box.  Voir dire continues.  Juror #39 struck for cause.  Court calls juror #41 to the jury box.  Voir dire continues.  Juror #15 struck for cause.  Court calls juror #42 to the jury box.  Court ORDERS the potential jurors not to do any sort of research on this case over the lunch hour, or anytime.  Court excuses the jurors for lunch break at 12:03 to return at 1:00 pm.  Parties address possible additional questions of the potential jurors.  Parties address juror #10, could is not striking this juror for cause at this time.  Court goes off the record at 12:11 pm.  Jury returns.  Court reconvenes at 1:00 pm.  Court addresses the jury.  Voir dire continues.  Juror #42 is struck for cause.  Court calls juror #43 to the jury box.  Voir dire continues.  Defense is requesting a short recess / sidebar at 1:13 pm.  Court excuses the jury from the Courtroom.  Court addresses the reason for the break.  Jury returned to the Courtroom at 1:17 pm.  Voir dire continued.   Court excuses the jury from the courtroom to address juror questions with the parties.   Parties address additional questions to be asked of the jury.  State does not request any potential juror be excused for cause.  Attorney Schleis moves for 1 juror to be released for cause, court denies this request.  Potential jury returns to the courtroom at 2:27 pm.  Court questions juror #36.  Jury selection begins.  Court reads the 14 jurors selected.  Jurors sworn in.  Court excuses the jurors from the courtroom.  Court addresses jury selection with the parties on the record.  Court addresses the opening jury instructions with the parties.  Jury returned to the courtroom at 3:10 pm.  Court reads the initial jury instructions.  Jurors are excused, to return tomorrow before 8:30 am.  Court will resume tomorrow 9/13/2016 at 8:30 am.  Witnesses will be excluded from the remainder of the trial.
